abstract: Lisa Edelstein, along with Nina Arianda and Dallas Roberts, show up this week on "The Good Wife," but is the show on slow boil?
snippet: Lisa Edelstein, along with Nina Arianda and Dallas Roberts, show up this week on "The Good Wife," but is the show on slow boil?
lead_paragraph: So just how quickly can the writers and producers of "The Good Wife" move? In Sunday night's episode, "Get a Room," Eli Gold did crisis management on an outbreak of listeria possibly caused by Wisconsin cheese. The current real-life listeria outbreak caused by Colorado cantaloupes became national news less than two weeks ago. That's some fancy dancing. (Of course, there was an E. coli outbreak in Wisconsin in mid-September, so maybe it was just a matter of subbing "listeriosis" in the script.) The resolution was ripped from a different headline: a pie in a chief executive's face, a la Rupert Murdoch.

headline.main: 'Good Wife' Watch: The Return of Cuddy, Er, Lisa Edelstein
